private_information: I can move disks: A, B, C, D, E (A is smallest, E larger).
I am restricted to move only those disks assigned to me.
agent_1.goal: Cooperate to reach the specified goal configuration across the three pegs.

private_information: I can move disks: F, G, H, I, J (F smaller than G ... J largest).
I am restricted to move only those disks assigned to me.
agent_2.goal: Cooperate to reach the specified goal configuration across the three pegs.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' move plans and produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that realizes the cooperative plan.

public_information: There are three pegs: left, middle, right.
Initial configuration on left peg (top to bottom): A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J. Middle peg is empty. Right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg (top to bottom): B, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg (top to bottom): A, C; right peg (top to bottom): D.
Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk can be moved at a time and a larger disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Agent move restrictions: agent_1 may move only disks A, B, C, D, E; agent_2 may move only disks F, G, H, I, J.
Moves must be expressed as primitive moves of a single disk from one peg to another.

plan.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You can move disks A, B, C, D, E only. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, respecting Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk restrictions. Do not produce PDDL. Use the exact move format: 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Include only moves that involve disks you are allowed to move. Base your plan on the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->agent_1->private_information} and the joint goal {agents->agent_1->goal}. Think step by step and ensure every move is legal given the disk sizes. If any information is missing, plan only for the portion you can control.

You are agent_2. You can move disks F, G, H, I, J only. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, respecting Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk restrictions. Do not produce PDDL. Use the exact move format: 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Include only moves that involve disks you are allowed to move. Base your plan on the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->agent_2->private_information} and the joint goal {agents->agent_2->goal}. Think step by step and ensure every move is legal given the disk sizes. If any information is missing, plan only for the portion you can control.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive the ordered primitive-move lists from agent_1 and agent_2. Integrate those plans into a single consistent solution and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeting the FastDownwards solver. Keep actions of the two agents distinct in the PDDL (for example, name actions like move_agent_1 and move_agent_2 or otherwise tag actions by agent). Ensure the domain encodes pegs, disks, size ordering, legal move preconditions (top disk, no larger-on-smaller), and effects. Ensure the problem encodes the initial arrangement and the goal arrangement exactly as given in the public information. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If the agents' plans conflict or are partial, resolve ambiguities explicitly and produce a correct PDDL pair that FastDownwards can accept. Do not output the combined primitive move list; output only the PDDL domain and problem enclosed in the required tags.
